Package com.phasmidsoftware.dsaipg.sort.classic

Class BucketSort<X extends Comparable<X>>

java.lang.Object
com.phasmidsoftware.dsaipg.sort.generic.SortWithHelper<X>
com.phasmidsoftware.dsaipg.sort.classic.ClassificationSorter<X,Void>
com.phasmidsoftware.dsaipg.sort.classic.BucketSort<X>
Type Parameters:
X - the underlying type which must extend Comparable.
All Implemented Interfaces:
Classifier<X,Void>, ProcessingSort<X>, Sort<X>, AutoCloseable
public class BucketSort<X extends Comparable<X>> extends ClassificationSorter<X,Void>
Bucket Sort.

CONSIDER re-implementing by doing ClassicSort first (based on buckets) then do insertion sort.

NOTE: there is an alternative implementation of BucketSort in the huskySort package. There are considerable differences so, for now, we'll leave both versions as is.

    • ALPHABET

      public static final String ALPHABET
      A constant string representing the alphabet, including a leading space. The string contains all lowercase English letters in sequential order, prefixed with a single space character. This can be used for operations requiring a defined sequence of characters, such as indexing or character mapping.

  • Method Details

    • classifyStringInitial

      public static Integer classifyStringInitial(String s)
      Classifies the initial character of a given string based on its position in the alphabet.
      Parameters:
      s - the input string whose initial character is to be classified. Must not be null or empty.
      Returns:
      the zero-based index of the initial character in the alphabet, or -1 if the character is not found.

    • classifyStringDigraph

      public static Integer classifyStringDigraph(String s)
      Classifies a digraph (two-character string) from the input string `s` based on a predefined list of digraphs. Converts the input string to lowercase and extracts the first two characters to form the digraph. If the predefined list of digraphs is not initialized, it gets constructed using all possible digraphs from the `ALPHABET`. The method then searches for the extracted digraph in the list using binary search.
      Parameters:
      s - the input string from which the digraph will be classified. It must contain at least one character.
      Returns:
      the index of the digraph in the predefined list of digraphs, or a negative value if the digraph is not found.

    • sort

      public void sort(X[] xs, int from, int to)
      Sorts the array `xs` within the specified range using a bucket sort approach. If a classifier is not defined and the type of elements in the array is not a number, a SortException is thrown. The method handles assigning elements to buckets, sorting within buckets, and eventually sorting the entire array.
      Parameters:
      xs - the array of elements to be sorted.
      from - the starting index of the range to be sorted (inclusive).
      to - the ending index of the range to be sorted (exclusive).
      Throws:
      SortException - if the classifier is undefined and the type of elements is not a number.

    • CaseIndependentBucketSort

      public static BucketSort<String> CaseIndependentBucketSort(Function<String,Integer> classifier, int nBuckets, int N, Config config)
      Creates a case-independent bucket sort instance using the provided classifier, number of buckets, size parameter, and configuration. This method returns a bucket sort implementation designed for strings where comparisons are case-insensitive.
      Parameters:
      classifier - a function that maps each string to an integer bucket index.
      nBuckets - the number of buckets to use for sorting.
      N - the number of elements to be processed (used primarily for helper initialization).
      config - the configuration settings to customize the sorting process.
      Returns:
      a BucketSort instance configured for case-insensitive string sorting.
